Master Answer:
In BC, Tuberculosis (TB) skin tests are either publicly funded (free) or at a cost, depending on the reason for your TB screening. Please contact your local health unit to ask if they provide TB skin tests and if you meet the criteria for free TB screening.
If you are not eligible for a free TB skin test, the test cost may range from $40-$70 available at most travel health clinics and some doctors' offices. Find a travel health clinic. Services vary across BC.
Immunization Nurse
Master Question: What is the cost of the TB Test?
